album.title: Girls Like You (feat. Cardi B) - Single

wiki.summary: "Girls Like You" is a song by American band Maroon 5 and serves as the ninth track on the band's sixth studio album, Red Pill Blues. It was written by Adam Levine, Cirkut, Cardi B, Starrah, Jason Evigan and Gian Stone and was produced by Cirkut and Evigan. It was released on June 5, 2018, as the third commercial single, featuring American rapper Cardi B. After extensive touring in support of their fifth studio album, V, Maroon 5 began the writing and recording sessions for their sixth studio album. Read more on Last.fm.
wiki.content: "Girls Like You" is a song by American band Maroon 5 and serves as the ninth track on the band's sixth studio album, Red Pill Blues. It was written by Adam Levine, Cirkut, Cardi B, Starrah, Jason Evigan and Gian Stone and was produced by Cirkut and Evigan. It was released on June 5, 2018, as the third commercial single, featuring American rapper Cardi B. After extensive touring in support of their fifth studio album, V, Maroon 5 began the writing and recording sessions for their sixth studio album. On October 11, 2016, the band released the tropical house single "Don't Wanna Know", featuring American rapper Kendrick Lamar. Another single, entitled "Cold", featuring American rapper Future, was released on February 14, 2017. The band released the lead single "What Lovers Do", featuring American singer SZA on August 30, 2017. On October 4, 2017, the group announced their sixth studio album Red Pill Blues. "Girls Like You" was revealed as the ninth track on Red Pill Blues via Apple Music. It was announced as the third official single from the album following the song "Wait". Recorded at Conway Recording Studios, Los Angeles, California. Songwriting – Adam Levine, Henry Walter, Cardi B, Starrah, Jason Evigan Production – Walter, Evigan Recording – Noah Passavoy Keyboards, synths – Isaiah Tejada Read more on Last.fm.
